meanings.definition: One of the two long shafts between which an animal is hitched to a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The horse pulled the wagon by the thill.
meanings.sent2: The thill of the carriage was sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent3: The thill decided it was tired of carrying the load and went on strike!
meanings.sent4: The thill bore the weight of responsibility with unwavering strength.
meanings.sent5: The thill creaked under the weight but never faltered in its duty.

meanings.definition: A shaft or bar that supports a wagon or carriage body.
meanings.sent1: The wooden thill held up the back of the wagon.
meanings.sent2: The thill was essential for keeping the carriage stable.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the thill as a balance beam.
meanings.sent4: The thill was the backbone of the carriage, ensuring a smooth ride.
meanings.sent5: The thill's strength was evident as it carried the weight effortlessly.
